field.label: Transplant status
field.toolTip:
• Unclassified - Patients that have not been seen or who have been seen but their classification
    has not yet been determined (for example, they are in work up)
  • Active - Patients on the national waiting list, with or without a live donor (some donors may be
    incompatible and the recipient is awaiting success in the paired exchange program or a deceased donor)
  • Ready - Patients that will never be made active (they have a live donor). Patients that have
    completed and passed the assessment but cannot be active for some reason and patients that are
    pre-dialysis but are not able to be made active yet (for example, they have not yet commenced dialysis)
  • Inactive - Patients that are ill or hospitalised, including cardiac procedure, chest pain needing
    investigation, collapse, commencement of clopidogrel, depression, infection (pneumonia,
    urinary tract infection, permcath sepsis, peritonitis, etc.), obesity, psychiatric problems, poor
    adherence to treatment, stroke, surgery, vascular disease needing review.
  • Off list - Patient is not suitable for transplant.
  • Transplanted - Patient has been transplanted.
